data.title: Lunch
data.text:
Turkey crousiant  all bread very little turkey .  Pricey
No cookie bargin like paradise bakery buy one get one free
Cookies 95 each.  Soup cup expensive

data.title: Unique!
data.text: Very cute and loads of delicious pastries!  We were looking for a place to grab a snack and this was terrific!

data.title: Inconsistent
data.text:
This restaurant would be great if you could depend on getting consistent food. Sometimes you end up with the end of a tomato or brown lettuce or barely any meat on the sandwich. I don't think I've had the salt and pepper mix the last 2 times I've gone. 
The breads, soups and desserts are great.

data.title: Even better than the previously visited
data.text: Came by to pick up soup to go for a sick friend.  Were treated as if we buy a huge amount of food.   On Bell road the best place for a light meal.

data.title: Good size portions and good tasking food
data.text: We ate there one Saturday morning recently for the first time.  I really liked the omelet I had as it not only had good flavor, but was not so huge as other restaurants.  There are many single choices and some pairings; all looked good.  The gift wrapping packages are beautiful.  Thought the pastries were a little pricey.  Loved ordering at the counter and having it delivered.  The eating area is not really large, but set up well and light and airy.  We will go back again.

data.title: Great Turkey, bacon, avocado salad!
data.text: I have enjoyed this dish a few times and really enjoy their customer service. They remember your name! How nice is that! Good food, nice atmosphere and relatively quick for lunch. Will keep going back!

data.title: Great pastries and baked goods!!
data.text: I have only eaten here once in the restaurant and it was very yummy, but I mainly go here for the breads and rolls and pastries.  The Mexican wedding cookies are like my mom used to make and the yeast rolls are soft and fresh and delish!  This is a great alternative to buying rolls etc at the grocery store!

data.title: Udelicious!
data.text: We love all their soups and breads and sandwiches, everything they serve us really good ! Price us good too, sometimes I go and get A Quart of soup to go !

data.title: Really good food on Bell!
data.text:
Not that all food near the Sun Cities is not good, but we are here for a month and found this cafe enlightening.

It turns out this is part of a restaurant group started in Utah, with places here and other cities.

The concept reminds me of Panera Bread. But this is better. They offer choices of breads with salad meals! I had Hazelnut 12 grain and it is so good. I had citrus salad. I got the large and will soon finish it for dinner.

My husband had a turkey croissant sandwich and a side green salad came with it at $6.79. We both ordered iced tea. They offer green, black and berry pomegranate teas today along with soft drinks-self serve.

We ordered at the counter. They delivered our food to the table. The servings are generous and I had the option to get a half salad.

Considering we had three meals and two drinks; out total at $20 is not bad at all.

I have not mentioned all of the bakery goods available and the gift basket services they provide.

I like the knew concept. We will go back. The have online ordering and a drive thru option also. 

We disposed of our papers and did not have to view dirty dishes-one of my complaints about Panera Bread. This feels more personal; in a good way.

I hope the will provide diners with more menu's describing the many options in the future.

data.title: Wonder baked goods.
data.text: This is a great cafe.  Salads are so good.  The pastries look and are amazing.  Its a must try.  Outdoor seating in nice weather.

data.title: A little disappointed
data.text: Found they had a good selection of pastries but a little expensive. We thought the soup, sandwiches, etc. we're lacking compared to their rival just 2 blocks away. Probably won't go back.

data.title: Delicious homemade style food!
data.text: Great eats!  Turkey sandwich was made with real turkey breast meat (reminded me of the sandwiches I make with leftover Thanksgiving Day turkey breast meat).  Soup was delicious (homemade chicken noodle).  Service was professional and friendly!  Although we didn't have any dessert, they had a great assortment of delicious looking choices.  I highly recommend!

data.title: My Favorite!
data.text: My husband's favorite is Paradise, but we both like Kneader's. This is my favorite. Cute gifts. Nice variety of breads, desserts, salads. Light and airy venue. Nice folks.

data.title: 2 half salads 1 cup of soup 2 bread pudding and a drink = $25.00 Really?
data.text: My first time was ok. The Food was very fresh and Good. Portions were just right, The Bread pudding Small serving for the price. The price seemed a little high. I would eat there again just knowing that its expensive for what you get.

data.title: YUMMY
data.text: I had lunch today and really enjoyed the chicken salad croissant sandwich - it came with a little side salad.

data.title: LOVE this Place
data.text: What a fun place to eat. There seems to nearly always be a line. You order your food, choose and seat and they bring it to you. You also get your own drinks. The unsweetened Passion Fruit iced tea is wonderful. They also have cutesie items for purchase. And the bakery looks amazing, although I have't had any baked goods yet. And, they are CLOSED on Sundays.

data.title: Cute Place
data.text: Kneaders Bakery is a cute place, and the food is fresh and pretty good. Their bread is delicious, so I recommend sandwiches. I had a salad, and it was good. We had a bad experience with a rude, snippy employee who got part of order wrong, then when asked to fix the order, evidently didn't turn in the change. The manager, after complaining, did make it right and adjusted the bill, so they did the right thing, but the experience had already been tainted.

data.title: Great first visit!
data.text: Unique! Wonderful selection of great food! Soups, sandwiches, salads, and a huge array of bakery items. We were very impressed, and would certainly visit again!

data.title: Came here twice!
data.text: I went to Kneader's for breakfast and got a delicious chocolate croissant and a fresh lemonade. As Arizona has lots of lemons, I couldn't resist not trying some fresh lemonade. It was well worth it. The chocolate croissant was also very delicious. A nice little breakfast. I loved it so much that I returned the next day to have the same thing. Excellent bakery and will return.

data.title: Drive-in for a Cinnamon Roll
data.text:
Good cinnamon roll & good steel cut oats.  Coffee...so, so as I prefer a good strong cup.
Place was clean
This is a walk up to the counter and place your order but it's always disconcerting when you are competing with staff that have a headset on taking drive up orders.  So it seemed understaffed.
No wi-fi
Lot's of frilly stuff and getting in the men's room one shouldn't have to deal with frilly wreathes on the door that almost haven't to fight to get to the door push.
Would I go back??  Only if there weren't other options which there are.
